name: Glossary
description:
"What's the ETA on the new CTA? We need to dogfood the UGC UX before we run an A/B."

Sound familiar? Each industry has it's own acronyms and terms, not to mention the internal rituals and codenames used within a company or team. How can you continue to communicate efficiently while making it easy for new team members to follow along?

The Glossary Pack can help! Define a set of terms and definitions in a shared Coda doc, and then use this Pack to reference them anywhere. You can inject a term from the glossary into free text, and when a user hovers over it they will be shown the definition. There is also the ability to identify and extract glossary terms in a text column, for example in a Dory (Q&A table).

To get started, copy the doc below to create your own glossary.

Icon by OpenMoji â€“ the open-source emoji and icon project. License: CC BY-SA 4.0.
Cover photo by Joshua Hoehne on Unsplash.
shortDescription: Lookup terms from a team or company glossary, created in a Coda doc.
